title: spec: Slicing a nil slice from 0:0 should not panic
body:
In the slices section, the spec says "If a is nil or if the indices are out of
range at run time, a run-time panic occurs." However, a runtime panic does not
occur if you slice a nil slice to start at 0 and have 0 length. 

http://play.golang.org/p/uiHY2dR_90

go version go1.1.1 darwin/amd64
